body.header:
Read this sample answer to the writing task in the last exercise and find the mistakes. There are 12. Click on them.
Writing Task 1

section.p: We don't know if the people surveyed attended cultural events or not.
The quality of the events is not referred to in the chart. A better phrase would be ...regarding cultural matters.
For three of the five statements, the vast majority agree or agree strongly.
74 per cent refers to New Zealanders.
What follows this linking phrase contrasts or contradicts the point which is made before. So it could be ... However,
We use 'as...as' to compare things. 'Such as' introduces examples.
'Than' follows as comparative adjective, 'bigger than' for example, but not comparatives with 'as'.

p.font: ...on some issues as it is on others.

section.p: After a comparative adjective we use 'than', not 'as'.
...those who think sport is more important...
The point that follows this linking phrase is another example of what New Zealanders disagree about.
